chunks.title: Structure and Functions Of Neuron    Control and Coordination  Class 10 science   Prashant kirad
chunks.text: This whole nervous system, do you know what it is working on? Neurons What are neurons? A cell, a cell that makes your whole nervous system Tell me one thing, we read in 9th that cells combine to make tissues Tissues combine and

chunks.title: Structure and Functions Of Neuron    Control and Coordination  Class 10 science   Prashant kirad
chunks.text: Similarly, when neurons combine, they make your nerves, and when nerves combine, it makes the entire nervous system. So what is the basic and functional unit? Neuron. Neuron is the largest cell of the human body.

chunks.title: Structure and Functions Of Neuron    Control and Coordination  Class 10 science   Prashant kirad
chunks.text: The length of a neuron can be up to 1 meter. Do you know how much 1 meter is? It is the largest cell of the human body. The length of a neuron can be up to 1 meter. Let's say you touched some hot water or a bottle.

chunks.title: Structure and Functions Of Neuron    Control and Coordination  Class 10 science   Prashant kirad
chunks.text: What do you have in your hand? Do you have receptors? Come on, tell me your name. Let's play a quiz. Tell me your name. Which receptor will make me feel hot? Tell me the name of the receptor. Let's see. Let's see. Who has how much pain?

chunks.title: Structure and Functions Of Neuron    Control and Coordination  Class 10 science   Prashant kirad
chunks.text: Neuron will leave the signal to your brain and it will bring the signal back to your brain. This is the structure of neuron. You can understand what neuron does. We will do the labeling later. Assume there is a signal. Whenever there is a signal in the body, Do you know in which form it is?

chunks.title: Structure and Functions Of Neuron    Control and Coordination  Class 10 science   Prashant kirad
chunks.text: in the form of chemical signals, ok. So, you can see these tips. What do these tips do? They say, come to me, right? So, these chemical signals, these tips call you to them and do you know in which signal these chemical signals are changed?

chunks.title: Structure and Functions Of Neuron    Control and Coordination  Class 10 science   Prashant kirad
chunks.text: Electrical, in electrical signal, okay. Now I am explaining it to you, keep understanding. Let's convert it in electrical signal. This is the whole cell. Let's convert it in electrical signal. Now that signal is inside. Okay, what is this? This is the cell body. You can see this, right? This is the cell body. And what is this? This is the nucleus. You can see the nucleus, right? Nucleus is like this.

chunks.title: Structure and Functions Of Neuron    Control and Coordination  Class 10 science   Prashant kirad
chunks.text: In 9th class, I taught you about Nucleus. Nucleus, right? So, what happens in the cell body? Your electrical signals come. Now, those electrical signals go ahead. Now, this is the cell body. And this is the tail of that neuron. Tail, right? This is also called axon. Let me show you further in labeling. This is also called axon. Now, from here, the signals go ahead.

chunks.title: Structure and Functions Of Neuron    Control and Coordination  Class 10 science   Prashant kirad
chunks.text: and the signal goes forward and forward. Now see, are you able to see a substance on it? Are you able to see this? Are you able to see this? Are you able to see this? Tell me, are you able to see this? What is this? Do you know what it is? Tell me one thing, have you ever seen a copper wire? The electric wire in your house. In the electric wire, there is a rubber coating on top.

chunks.title: Structure and Functions Of Neuron    Control and Coordination  Class 10 science   Prashant kirad
chunks.text: There is a copper wire inside. Why? So that the current can flow properly. This is what happens. There are insulators outside. Insulators. And inside, there is a copper wire. Similarly, because the electrical signal has to go from here. The electrical signal has to go from inside.

chunks.title: Structure and Functions Of Neuron    Control and Coordination  Class 10 science   Prashant kirad
chunks.text: What do we do outside? There is an insulated coating near the neuron so that the signal does not run here and there. For example, when we want to flow current, we need a rubber covering on top of the wiring. We also need a covering here. This is called myelin sheath.

chunks.title: Structure and Functions Of Neuron    Control and Coordination  Class 10 science   Prashant kirad
chunks.text: I'll tell you right now, don't worry. After that, the signal came here. Now this is my nerve ending. This is what you are seeing. This is my nerve ending. This is my nerve ending. Because this is the end of the nerve. Now the signal from here Now this signal will go beyond this.

chunks.title: Structure and Functions Of Neuron    Control and Coordination  Class 10 science   Prashant kirad
chunks.text: will be converted into chemicals again and again. In what? In chemicals. Okay, the signal came out from here, converted into chemicals. Now, now, now, now, now, this is a neuron. This is a neuron. Assume, assume, this was a N1. It was N1. Now, there is another neuron ahead of this. Because neuron, neuron, neuron, neuron.

chunks.title: Structure and Functions Of Neuron    Control and Coordination  Class 10 science   Prashant kirad
chunks.text: Neurons are connected, right? There are a lot of neurons together, right? There are a lot of neurons together, right? So neurons are connected. So one neuron, second neuron, third neuron. Now there is another neuron ahead. Now the signal from here was converted back to the chemical. Now that chemical will go back. Now there is another neuron here. Now the same problem.

chunks.title: Structure and Functions Of Neuron    Control and Coordination  Class 10 science   Prashant kirad
chunks.text: The same process will happen again It will be converted to electrical again From electrical it will come to the cell body From cell body it will go ahead There is a covering provided here It will go to nerve ending It will go to the next neuron Did we understand this process? How our signal will be transferred?

chunks.title: Structure and Functions Of Neuron    Control and Coordination  Class 10 science   Prashant kirad
chunks.text: These are the tips of the neuron. These are the tips. We call them dendrites. What do we call dendrites? What does dendrites do? Dendrites receive chemical signals. Dendrites receive chemical signals and convert them into electrical signals. Who will do it? Dendrites.

chunks.title: Structure and Functions Of Neuron    Control and Coordination  Class 10 science   Prashant kirad
chunks.text: So directly chemical signal came and in which it changed? In electrical with the help of dendrite. Signal came from dendrite and where did it come? It came on our cell body. Where did it come son? On cell body. It comes on our cell body. So this came on our cell body. Cell body what is this?

chunks.title: Structure and Functions Of Neuron    Control and Coordination  Class 10 science   Prashant kirad
chunks.text: nucleus, we call it cell body. This is the whole cell body. Now it will go ahead. Now you can see its tail. This tail we call it axon. What do we call it? Axon. What is the function of axon? To transfer the signal. To transfer the signal. Okay, now see.

chunks.title: Structure and Functions Of Neuron    Control and Coordination  Class 10 science   Prashant kirad
chunks.text: What you are seeing here is called Myelin Sheath. What does it do? It provides an insulation so that the signal comes out easily. Like I explained to you with the example of wire. This is Myelin Sheath. Now your signal has come out, signal has come out, signal has come out.

chunks.title: Structure and Functions Of Neuron    Control and Coordination  Class 10 science   Prashant kirad
chunks.text: The signal went out, the signal went out â€“ now here comes your nerve ending. Nerve ending, nerve ending â€“ Oh this nerve ending, it has another name, it's called Synaptic Synaptic Nodes Synaptic Nodes Synaptic Nodes

chunks.title: Structure and Functions Of Neuron    Control and Coordination  Class 10 science   Prashant kirad
chunks.text: This is also called SCOM. Here your electrical signal is converted back to chemical. What is next? There is another neuron. What is next? There is another neuron. My son is sitting in front.

chunks.title: Structure and Functions Of Neuron    Control and Coordination  Class 10 science   Prashant kirad
chunks.text: There is another neuron and its dendrites are there and there is another neuron standing and it is trying to favor it.... Then look at the gap between one neuron and the other unknown neuron

chunks.title: Structure and Functions Of Neuron    Control and Coordination  Class 10 science   Prashant kirad
chunks.text: There is a small gap between two neurons. For example, you are standing in an assembly. There is a one hand distance. Similarly, the gap between two neurons that gap is called Synapse. That gap is called Synapse.
